parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
